name: BSU Achievements
blurb: The gamification of education at Ball State University.
description: Ball State Achievements allows Ball State students to complete Achievements and recieve rewards by participating in the college experience. Students may choose from several categories such as Athletics, Academics, Culture, Exploration, and more to find Achievements they are interested in completing. Upon completion, they will be rewarded with Experience and Bennies that they can spend in the Store to purchase real merchandise from the BSU Bookstore.
bullets: Led team of 4 students to release of Android application to 1200 Ball State incoming freshmen that later grew to include 3000 underclassmen at Ball State University.
Developed data abstraction layer linking Android Achievements client and Achievements API, including caching of up to 4000 records.

name: Content Pipeline Tooling
blurb: Scripting/content pipeline tools for in-house game engine.
description: A tooling system for an in-house game engine at the Digital Corps. Used a web-based front-end to allow designers and writers to input scripts and assets. An API allowed the scripts and assets to be exported into formats the game engine could read. I implemented a set of bash scripts that would poll the API daily and build the new assets into the project, committing the build if it succeeded. Additional scripts would allow developers more control over the importation of assets.
bullets: Handled assets for a 6-hours of gameplay
Automated import of assets into game engine

name: BSU Map App
blurb: Mobile app to guide students and visitors on Ball State's campus.
description: Explore every corner of Ball State University in Muncie, Indiana, and navigate the college experience from the palm of your hand. BSU's Campus Map is exactly what every student needs to manage time wisely. That means no more getting lost, missing meetings, or last minute struggles to park your car. And it's not just about getting from place to place; you can find hotspots, search for buildings, departments and more.
bullets: Led team to update Android and iOS versions
Maintained application over 2 years of use, including through major OS updates

name: BSU Rec App
blurb: Usage statistics for BSU recreation facilities.
description: The Ball State University Recreation Services App helps students, faculty, staff, alumni and guests identify if their favorite recreation facilities are busy. Updated in real time, there's no need to waste time heading to the gym only to find it too crowded. The Rec app helps you easily identify how busy all areas of the Student Recreation & Wellness Center, Ball Gymnasium, and Lewellen Pool are. Go when you feel comfortable, knowing you will get the most out of your workout. Users can subscribe to recreation areas and/or activities and be notified of a special event, closure or other notices that need to be announced through a text message
bullets: Built front-end administrative tools to track usage of Ball State's recreation facilities
Designed API to provide information to mobile clients

name: Circuit Soaker
blurb: Competitive multiplayer game for Ball State University's touch board and iOS.
description: Using the large multi-user touch board outside of the Digital Corps office as a host, we built a multiplayer line defense game. The defending player begins a game on the touch board defending their base from computer controlled robots attempting to destroy the power station. Passersby can join in, taking control of the attacking robots, on their iOS devices.
bullets: Synchronous competitive multipayer game across Windows touch screen and iOS devices
Push notifications to iOS to alert users to possible games
Java-based host server to communicate across platforms

name: Project Devourer
blurb: On-set rough cuts using footage imported to an iPad.
description: An app for the quick editing of films for rough cuts on set. Shoot footage from your iPad or import footage to the iPad to use simple non-linear editing tools to create daily cuts. Export the cuts to Final Cut Pro or Adobe Premier for more refined editing later.
bullets: Export rough-cuts to formats for import into Adobe Premier and Final Cut Pro
Built non-linear editing timeline using custom iOS views

name: Exceptional Me
blurb: Time management calendar app for twice-exceptional primary school students on iPad

name: Digital Corps Adventure Camp
blurb: A one-week summer camp to teach high schoolers how to program.
